title: Warhammer 40,000's First Encyclopedia Looks Like The Perfect Entry Point For New Fans
description: The Warhammer 40,000 universe is vast, spanning hundreds of books, video games, and--of course--the tabletop wargame. It can be intimidating to get into, but the upcoming Warhammer 40,000: The Ultimate Guide hardcover book launching October 29 is looking like one of the best introductions to this massive fictional setting. Preorders are available at Amazon, and you can grab it right now for a slight discount at $40.50 (normally $45). Warhammer 40,000: The Ultimate Guide $40.50 (was $45) The Warhammer 40,000: The Ultimate Guide is written by Guy Haley and Gav Thorpe, who have previously written numerous other Warhammer novels. The 336-page encyclopedia is packed with lore for each of 40K's many factions, plus illustrations and high-quality photos of the tabletop miniatures, including detailed looks at how each army and their most important characters have evolved over each edition of the game. If you're curious to know more about the Imperium of Man, its super-powered Space Marine soldiers, and its many enemies (and victims), or you're a veteran looking to admire some professionally painted minis, this book has it all. Preorder at Amazon Gallery Warhammer 40,000: The Ultimate Guide seems like it could be the perfect way for newcomers who recently got into the series thanks to Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 a better picture of the wider universe the game hints at. However, if you want to dip into the many novels, video games, and tabletop games set in the grimdark far future, be sure to check out our guide on where to start with Warhammer 40,000.Dungeons & Dragons - Worlds & Realms: Adventures from Greyhawk to Faerun and BeyondDungeons & Dragons - Worlds & Realms: Adventures from Greyhawk to Faerun and BeyondCoincidentally, the other wildly popular legacy tabletop game, Dungeons & Dragons, is also getting a new book on October 29 that details its massive fantasy multiverse. Worlds & Realms: Adventures from Greyhawk to Faerun and Beyond is part art book, sourcebook, and novel, featuring art from across the game's history alongside in-universe lore and short stories set in the many realms and planes of existence D&D has explored over the last 50 years. Fans can preorder the book at Amazon, where it's discounted to just $35 (down from $50).Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6 Zombies - How To Unlock The Loot Vault On Liberty Falls
description: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's Liberty Falls might be a smaller Zombies map, but it still contains some secrets to explore. One Easter egg includes gaining access to a locked vault, which contains free randomized loot items. Here is everything you need to know to find, unlock, and use the loot vault in Liberty Falls.How to find the loot vaultSavings and Loan bank vault The vault is inside the map's bank point-of-interest called "Savings and Loans," and you can access this location by starting from the left or right side map barrier. Either path choice costs the same here.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Balatro gets a second set of free card cosmetics inspired by Cyberpunk 2077, Stardew Valley and others
description: I played Balatro for an hour, had a pleasant time, then uninstalled it. I know a trap when I see one. Perhaps you are made of stronger stuff than I am, however. Perhaps you like that monkey on your back. For you, there's a new free update, which adds a second set of themed card art to the game inspired by the games Binding Of Isaac, Cyberpunk 2077, Stardew Valley and Slay The Spire. Read more

title: Windblown, the new co-op hack-and-slasher from Dead Cells' developers, is out in Early Access now
description: Windblown looks rad. It's an action-roguelite for 1-3 players in which you dash-and-slash in rapid combat on floating islands, and I am extremely interested in feeling its game-feel for myself. Good news! I can get my game-feelers on it now because it's out in Early Access today. If you watch its launch trailer below out of context however, you might be fooled into thinking it's actually the emo second half of an Isekai anime series. Read more

title: A Visit to Fioli House and Gardens in Woodside
description: I’ve lived in the Bay Area practically all of my life and had no idea that this gorgeous place existed. Fioli Historic House and Gardens is just about an hour away from where I live Marin county. It’s in the peninsula, south of San Francisco. Back in the day, it was a private residence, but now you can visit it and explore the mansion and the grounds. I went a couple weeks ago with my friends, Jen and Cindy; you might remember them from the MAC Evolution Revolution launch from waaaay back when. 🙂 We had tea at the cafe, explored the gardens and caught up. Sometimes I can’t believe that I used to talk to these two and see them every day. That’s one of the magical things of my childhood and teenage years that I didn’t fully understand the wonder of until I got older. To be able to say that I spent almost every day of my formative years with good friends was such a gift. Anywho, back to the gardens! Everywhere[Continue reading...] The post A Visit to Fioli House and Gardens in Woodside appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 853
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. Are you contemplating any limited edition holiday makeup releases? I usually prefer products in the permanent collections because in my experience holiday makeup performs differently for whatever reason. I do love a holiday fragrance set, though! 2. Are BB creams worth your time? My answer was no back in the day, but now that I’m into minimal base, I’m thinking it could be good if I find one that agrees with my skin. Hmm, maybe that will be my next makeup project – finding “the one.” I stumbled onto this one by Dr. Jart and it looks pretty good. 3. Your favorite video game? It’s all about old school Tetris on a Gameboy, baby! 4.Advice you wish you would’ve received as a young person? I wish someone[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 853 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
